alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 03 at 11:39AM MDT until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... Washington... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Shoshone and Kootenai Counties. Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. St Joe River at Calder affecting Shoshone County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...From Friday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Water will be up to Aqua Avenue in St Maries near Leeve hill and walking trail. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 30.7 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached late Friday morning. The river is expected to crest Saturday evening before receding over the weekend while still remaining above flood stage. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat St Joe River St Maries 32.5 30.7 Wed 9 am PDT 32.0 32.5 35.1 &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1100 AM PDT.
